title-part.text: SPRING, WEIGHT, INERTIA OR LIKE MOTORS
MECHANICAL-POWER PRODUCING DEVICES OR MECHANISMS, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR OR USING ENERGY SOURCES NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

reference.text: arrangements in connection with power supply in vehicles from force of nature B60K16/00; electric propulsion with power supply in vehicles from force of nature B60L8/00

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the following term is used with the meaning indicated: "motors" means mechanisms for producing mechanical power from potential energy of solid bodies.

title-part.text: Spring motors

reference.text: spring-driven toys A63H; springs in general F16F; precision time mechanisms, e.g. for clocks or watches, G04B

title-part.text: characterised by shape or material of spring, e.g. helical, spiral, coil

fluid contact

of the Organic Rankine Cycle [ORC] type or the Kalina Cycle type
having other power cycles, e.g. Stirling, transcritical or supercritical cycles; combined with other power sources, e.g. wind, gas or nuclear
